meanings.definition: To cause the destruction of something
meanings.sent1: The storm will wreck the sandcastle we built.
meanings.sent2: The car crash could wreck the fence.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally wrecked my brother's Lego tower.
meanings.sent4: His careless actions could wreck his chances of winning.
meanings.sent5: The strong winds threatened to wreck the fragile tent.

meanings.definition: A vehicle or ship that has been severely damaged or destroyed
meanings.sent1: The old wreck of a ship sat abandoned on the shore.
meanings.sent2: The wreck of the car was towed away from the accident scene.
meanings.sent3: The kids pretended the broken bicycle was a pirate ship wreck.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned wreck of a house stood as a reminder of the past.
meanings.sent5: The rusted wreck of the plane was a haunting sight in the desert.

meanings.definition: A state of ruin or destruction
meanings.sent1: The abandoned building was a wreck after the fire.
meanings.sent2: The town was left in a wreck after the tornado passed through.
meanings.sent3: The messy room was a wreck with toys scattered everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The relationship was a wreck after the argument.
meanings.sent5: The garden was a wreck of tangled plants and overgrown weeds.
